intro: Meriania heptamera, commonly known as the seven-lobed meriania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and its stems are often woody and branched. Meriania heptamera is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories, where it thrives in partial to full shade. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
